text:
org/apache/xmlgraphics/xmp/Metadata.java contains the statement

handler.startElement(XMPConstants.RDF_NAMESPACE, "RDF", "rdf:Description", atts);

Where handler is a org.xml.sax.ContentHandler and org.xml.sax.ContentHandler.startElement()’s 2nd and 3rd arguments are defined thus:

localName - The local name (without prefix), or the empty string if Namespace processing is not being performed.

qName - The qualified name (with prefix), or the empty string if qualified names are not available.

Thus given a 3rd argument of "rdf:Description" it is invalid for the 2nd argument to be anything other than "" or,"RDF".

I believe this to be a simple typo that appears twice in the source file.

The conseqence of this is that (presumably dependant on what SAX XML serialiser is used), you get <rdf:RDF> elements where you should be getting <rdf:Description> ones.
creator: nobull67@gmail.com
nobull67@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #0)

> Thus given a 3rd argument of "rdf:Description" it is invalid for the 2nd
> argument to be anything other than "" or,"RDF".

Should, of course, have said...

Thus given a 3rd argument of "rdf:Description" it is invalid for the 2nd
argument to be anything other than "" or "Description".

creator: spepping@apache.org
text: Fixed in revision 1130449. Thanks for reporting.
